text: The 2003 Asian Cycling Championships took place at Changwon, South Korea from 4 to 13 August 2003. ==Medal summary== ===Road=== ====Men==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ====Women==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ===Track=== ====Men==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |1 km time trial | | | |- |Keirin | | | |- |Individual pursuit | | | |- |Points race | | | |- |Scratch | | | |- |Elimination | | | |- |Madison | Yuriy Yuda Vladimir Bushanskiy | Kwak Hoon-sin Suh Seok-kyu | Amir Zargari Abbas Saeidi Tanha |- |Team sprint | Masaki Inoue Yuichiro Maesori Hiroyuki Inagaki |valign=top| |valign=top| |- |Team pursuit |valign=top| Song Kyung-bang Choi Soon-young Jang Sun-jae Kwak Hoon-sin | Alireza Haghi Mehdi Sohrabi Abbas Saeidi Tanha Amir Zargari Hossein Askari |valign=top| Takashi Sasaki Kei Uchida Taiji Nishitani Yusuke Kuroki |} ====Women==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |500 m time trial | | | |- |Keirin | | | |- |Individual pursuit | | | |- |Points race | | | |- |Scratch | | | |- |Elimination | | | |- |Team sprint | Maya Tachikawa Masumi Shinozaki Tomoko Endo | Tian Fang Ni Fenghan Jiang Yanxia | Kim Sun-hee Ahn Yun-hee Lee Jong-ae |- |Team pursuit | Li Meifang Qian Yunjuan Zhang Junying Jiang Yanxia | Gu Sung-eun Han Song-hee Choi Hye-kyeong Lim Hyung-joon |None awarded |} ==Medal table== ==External links== * www.cycling.or.kr Asia Asia Cycling Category:Asian Cycling Championships Category:International cycle races hosted by South Korea Category:Sport in Changwon
